results.adx_keywords: Classical Music;DNA (Deoxyribonucleic Acid);Hair;Hepatitis;Genetics and Heredity;Liver;Poisoning and Poisons;Lead;Research;internal-sub-only;Genealogy;Beethoven, Ludwig van;Current Biology (Journal)
results.title: DNA From Beethoven’s Hair Unlocks Medical and Family Secrets
results.abstract: By analyzing seven samples of hair said to have come from Ludwig van Beethoven, researchers debunked myths about the revered composer while raising new questions about his life and death.

media.copyright: Joseph Karl Stieler, via Beethoven-Haus Bonn

results.adx_keywords: School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Lyle, Austin;East High School (Denver, Colo);Denver (Colo)
results.title: Denver Student Shoots 2 School Administrators, Police Say
results.abstract: The 17-year-old student, who was later found dead, had been under a safety plan that required he be searched before entering the school.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Long Covid;Chronic Condition (Health);Research;Diabetes;Vaccination and Immunization;Obesity;your-feed-healthcare;JAMA Internal Medicine (Journal)
results.title: Who Is Most at Risk for Long Covid?
results.abstract: A new analysis summarizes the emerging picture of factors that make long-term post-Covid symptoms more likely.

media.caption: A patient living with long Covid since her infection in March 2020 in Massachusetts. The analysis involved a total of 860,783 patients and found patients were more likely to be female.

results.adx_keywords: Kidnapping and Hostages;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Rescues;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Houston (Tex)
results.byline: By Christine Hauser, Jesus Jiménez and Livia Albeck-Ripka
results.title: Suspect Dead After Hostages Rescued in Houston F.B.I. Operation
results.abstract: Several hostages were rescued during a multiday operation involving multiple law enforcement agencies, the F.B.I. said. One suspect died after “an agent-involved shooting” and a second was taken into custody.

media.caption: One person died and several hostages were rescued during an operation involving local and federal law enforcement in North Houston.
media.copyright: Ralph Green/Houston Chronicle, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Traffic Accidents and Safety;Deaths (Fatalities);Roads and Traffic;Baltimore County (Md);Maryland;Woodlawn (Md)
results.byline: By Johnny Diaz and Eduardo Medina
results.title: Driver Strikes Highway Workers in Maryland, Killing 6
results.abstract: The six workers, including two brothers from El Salvador and a father and son, were pronounced dead after they were struck on Interstate 695 outside Baltimore, the authorities said.

media.caption: The authorities said the driver of an Acura struck the highway workers as she tried to change lanes on Interstate 695 in Woodlawn, Md., on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Jerry Jackson/The Baltimore Sun, via Associated Press

results.title: Our Film Critic on Why He’s Done With the Movies
results.abstract: A.O. Scott discusses how American cinema has evolved over his 23 years at The New York Times.

results.adx_keywords: International Relations;United States International Relations;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Xi Jinping;Putin, Vladimir V;China;Russia;Ukraine
results.title: In a Brother Act With Putin, Xi Reveals China’s Fear of Containment
results.abstract: Instead of focusing on a solution to the war in Ukraine, the Chinese leader’s visit to Moscow reinforced China and Russia’s shared opposition to American dominance.

media.caption: A photo released by Russian state media on Tuesday showing the Chinese leader, Xi Jinping, who was greeted with pomp and pageantry on his visit to Moscow.

results.adx_keywords: Cooking and Cookbooks;Rice;Microwave Ovens;Content Type: Service
results.title: For Perfectly Cooked Rice Every Time, Try Your Microwave
results.abstract: It may seem sacrilegious to stovetop loyalists, but when it comes to consistency, this household appliance is a weeknight meal’s best friend.

media.caption: Cooking rice in the microwave can yield uniformly cooked grains without much effort.
media.copyright: Julia Gartland for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Barrett Washburne.

results.title: Arizona Supreme Court Turns Down Kari Lake’s Appeal in Her Election Lawsuit
results.abstract: The justices refused to hear Ms. Lake’s claims disputing her loss in the governor’s race, but sent one part of her lawsuit back to a trial court for review.

media.caption: Kari Lake, a Republican who was defeated by Katie Hobbs in the Arizona governor’s race last fall, had made false election claims the centerpiece of her campaign.

results.title: The Best Way to Comfort Someone When They’re Sad
results.abstract: A limited yet growing body of research suggests that one of the most powerful ways to support someone is also the simplest: Start a conversation.

results.title: 5 Exercises to Keep an Aging Body Strong and Fit
results.abstract: Declines in muscle and bone strength start earlier than you might think. Build a smart workout habit now.

results.title: Prosecutor in Trump Hush-Money Case Fires Back at House Republicans

results.title: Centuries of Stargazing Leave Jesuit Names Written in the Heavens
results.abstract: The latest list of approved labels for asteroids includes nods to three more scholars of the order, as well as a pope, challenging the idea that science and religion make awkward partners.

media.caption: Brother Guy Consolmagno, director of the Vatican’s observatory near Rome, in 2017. The observatory, or Specola Vaticana, has roots dating to Pope Gregory XIII in the 16th century.

results.title: I Love You, but I Don’t Want to Sleep With You
results.abstract: Snoring and conflicting schedules are top reasons couples decide to sleep in separate bedrooms. Sex therapists and marriage counselors have their doubts about the arrangement.

media.caption: Cara and Rich Newhart began sleeping apart at the beginning of the pandemic and stuck with the arrangement when they bought a new house in New Jersey.

results.title: The Billionaire’s Daughter Knows What You’re Thinking
results.abstract: Elizabeth Koch, the daughter of the right-wing political force Charles Koch, is working to bridge societal divides. Sure, roll your eyes. But also, why not her?

results.abstract: There is magic in the moment when you realize you’ve found a friend like no other. What if we celebrated that kind of connection more?
